alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Grady (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lafayette, Gadsden, northwestern Jefferson, northern Taylor, Leon, Madison and southern Decatur Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 626 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greensboro to near Dowling Park. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Woodville, Monticello, Mayo, Florida State University, Tallahassee Community College, Quincy, Havana, Midway, Madison, Florida A and M, Perry, Doak Campbell Stadium, Chattahoochee, Greensboro, Gretna, Greenville, Lee, Lake Bradford and Cody. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
